channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If youâ€™re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace Iâ€™m actively jealous of!

item.title: Be a trailblazer in a time of growth - Full Stack Architect required for a rapidly expanding London company
item.description: If youâ€™re currently a senior full stack developer looking to take on your next role as an architect then this is a great opportunity to do so in a company that is both ambitious and supportive. Increased job satisfaction is another perk, as their codebase is notably new and clean and the team are committed to using modern practices.

item.title: Rapid Growth in Perl - developers wanted for an expanding central London company
item.description: According the Guinness Book of World Records, the fastest growing plant is a species of bamboo, which grows at a rate of up to 91cm a day. The fastest growing economy in the world is currently Ethiopia, with a projected growth in GDP of over 8% this year. And although the record for fastest growing Perl team might not be recorded in the Guinness Book of records, our client is a strong contender.

item.title: How to dereference a reference to a hash or to an array in Perl
NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: December 6th-10th
Bailador + Dancer SPA + Collab dev bundle
item.description: As a Christmas special I am also offering my 3 books in a bundle at a very deep discount.

item.title: Minimum Viable Perl
item.description: Announced on his blog you can find a web based Perl tutorial. Read the Reddit comments.

item.title: The Year of Perl 6 Books
item.description: Listing all the Perl 6 related books

item.title: Regenerating Perl School
item.description: Instead of class-room training sessions, this time Dave is working on cheap eBooks about various topics in Perl sold via Amazon. The first one is called Perl Taster: Your First Two Hours With Perl. I'd say even if you don't need it, buy it as a way to encourage and support Dave. Even better, buy a copy as a present to a fellow Perl newbie.

item.title: Modulino: both script and module in Perl
item.description: Sometimes you'd want to allow people to use the functions from your script and sometime you'd like to run your module as if it was a script. Based on the comments on the article and on Reddit, not everybody liked, but I learned that the word was actually coined by brian d foy. I also got some ideas for more use-cases.

item.title: Many Sides of Moose!!
item.description: John goes on with his series on marrying Moose with Databases. This time making the Data Accessor smart enough that is would know what Driver to use form the connection passed in.

item.title: (Update) Inline::F2003 - An ILSM for modern FORTRAN
Patreon and Perl
item.description: Patreon allows you to support people with a small monthly payment.

item.title: Advent Planet 2017
item.description: The collection of all the Advent calendars.

item.title: Mojolicious Advent Calendar
item.description: Joel has started a new blog for Mojolicious, and is kicking it off in grand style, with an Advent calendar.

item.title: Perl 6 Advent Calendar
item.description: Every year since 2009--no fancy calendar, just great blog entries every year in the weeks leading up to Christmas.

item.title: TPC and The End of Language Dominance
#334 - Happy Birthday Perl!
item.description:
Hi there,

This year the Perl Weekly is published on the 30th birthday of Perl.

How do you celebrate?

Use this opportunity to send a thank-you note to Larry Wall, to someone who have contributed to Perl throughout the years, to a CPAN author who maintains a module you use!

Happy Birthday to all the readers!
